data.title: Great Food
data.text: The food is really good here. It's a southern Jamaican style type food. It's located in the downtown area of Syracuse. The people who works here are very nice also.

data.title: OUT OF THIS WORLD HOMEMADE COOKING.
data.text: This is one place in Syracuse, New York you do not want to miss for home made cooking. I had the Goat Jerk with rice and veggies. The spice is hot but not real hot. They have milder seasoned dishes also. The husband and wife are the friendliest people you will ever meet. We went for lunch and it wasn't crowded. You can order take out. Do not leave Syracuse without trying the cooking at The Jamerican Diner.

data.title: A Taste of Home
data.text:
This is what I think, the food is good but to me leaving out that taste of scotch bonnet pepper in the oxtails is a no-no. This is the essence of that authentic taste. I will return to try the curry goat.
Overall I love the owner and her personality and the vibe of the place. Typical Jamaican Restaraunt, it felt like home in a different city. I will recommend this place for good food.

data.title: Auntentic
data.text: I love this restaurant .this place served the real jamaican food,it's clean and the staff is very helpful.you can eat in or take out.and the location is in the heart of downtown Syracuse .I will visit this restaurant again ,my only fault is ,it needs a little more light inside.

data.title: New tastes
data.text:
A small place near downtown and just a few blocks from the canal museum.  Many interesting items on the menu, things we hadn't tried anywhere, so we ordered them.  Wonderful!

Large portions, good prices, extensive menu of Jamaican foods, helpful staff.  We'll definitely return.

data.title: Something different!
data.text: Ordered the curry chicken with a side of beans and rice . . . food was GREAT and they give you a TON for your money.  Has a different feel to it then your average restaurant, cute atmosphere with the music and décor.  Great for lunch on the go!

data.title: Worth the Wait
data.text: I have eaten twice at The Jamerican Diner and loved it both times.  I had their Curry Goat special and a Jerk Burger.  Both meals were delicious.  It takes a couple of minutes to get your meal at lunch time, but, as I said, it's ...

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I really enjoyed the spices they put in the food however, I gave it 4 stars because I am not a fan of so many green peppers. Overall, customer service is great!

data.title: Awesome
data.text: This place was great! Totally authentic Jamaican food. Curry was great. Meat patties ...WOW. I loved my ox tail. Jerk chicken was top of the line. Staff was very friendly. This is my new favorite!

data.title: non-spicy curry
data.text: The food was pretty good just that I like my curry to be very spicy the rest of the food was on point

data.title: Oh wow my favorite
data.text: U must no matter what kind of food u like u must come here it will  knock your socks off the food is good it will change  your language  if u don't speak  another

data.title: Authentic Jamaican Cooking
data.text: My wife and I wanted to check out a good Caribbean restaurant because being from NYC there never was a lack of good Jamaican food. We'll let me start out by saying if you want good, and I mean good authentic Jamaican cooking then you must check out this little gem in downtown Syracuse. I had the curry goat which was well seasoned with potatoes and carrots,  rice and peas, some shredded cabbage and carrots and some sweet ripe plantain.  My wife had the oxtail which had a thick and delicious brown gravy also with potatoes and carrots. All I can say that this is hands down the best Jamaican food I have had since moving upstate. If you want to experience some true carribean cooking then definitely check this place out. They also have escovitch fish, curry chicken, jerk chicken, and brown stew beef. I will be coming back again. And I also want to add how friendly and accommodating the staff is.

data.title: Jamaica in Syracuse
data.text: This place has GREAT food and a decor that is right out of a bus station.  I'll come back for the food. They even have real imported  ginger beer [non-alcoholic].

data.title: Amazing!!
data.text: I did not know that Syracuse had such a place!  I received an online coupon to use at this restaurant so I decided to give it a try. I'm so glad I did. The oxtail was amazing! My husband had the curry goat and says it's the best he's had in a long time and he grew up on west indian cuisine. I highly recommend this hidden gem.

data.title: Great breakfast, smiling service
data.text:
If you are looking for American breakfast food, a Jamaican diner may not be your first choice... but this place should be.  We walked in for breakfast at around 10:30 am.  They were getting ready for their lunch service but since their Jamaican fare was not quite ready, we decided to go for breakfast.  We had omelettes, home-fires, fried plantains, and fried dough.  Both the Ham and Cheese Omelette and the Western Omelette were perfectly prepared. The home-fries were soft, with just that little bit of crunch.  The fried dough and the fried plantains perfectly complimented the meal. Nothing fancy but very well done.  

We were served by a very friendly, woman and you just could not help but smile along with her.

Definitely a place to go to when in Syracuse.

data.title: Food from Heaven!
data.text: This is the place to come if you're feeling cold or blue. The food will spice up your soul and warm you to  the tips of your toes and fingers.  The owner is gracious and smiles and makes you feel happy with the cooking and the music and the conversation. Give it a try never had  Jamaican food before.

data.title: A hidden gem
data.text: This is a new restaurant that opened 4-1-13 in a small location downtown. I heard about it through an article at www.syracuse.com My friend and I went and we each had a Jerk Burger.  You can get selected toppings and cheeses and spiciness ranging from mild, medium, hot up to hot hot! I have tried both hot and hot hot and the burger was fantastic! The fries were very tasty, and on a previous visit I had the potato salad, which was excellent as well. They make their own hot sauce.It is locally owned and operated. It does a lot of take-out business but you can certainly sit down for a meal on a lunch hour as well. I highly recommend this little gem in downtown Syracuse!
